meanings.definition: Deprive (a man) of his male role or identity.
meanings.sent1: Bullying can be emasculating for some boys in school.
meanings.sent2: The villain's plan was to emasculate the hero by destroying his reputation.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show joked about a superhero getting emasculated by his sidekick.
meanings.sent4: The toxic environment at work was slowly emasculating his confidence.
meanings.sent5: The strict rules of the club were emasculating for new members.

meanings.definition: Make (someone or something) weaker or less effective.
meanings.sent1: The virus was emasculating the computer system, causing it to crash.
meanings.sent2: The lack of resources was emasculating the team's ability to compete.
meanings.sent3: The constant rain was emasculating the strength of the old wooden fence.
meanings.sent4: The harsh criticism was emasculating her enthusiasm for the project.
meanings.sent5: The intense heat was emasculating the performance of the car engine.
